fields.description:
While investigating PARQUET-1438 we have discovered that there is a regression in arrow-cpp testsuite results between versions 0.10.0 and 0.11.0 when running in 32 bit executable. There used to be just a single test failing:

* array-test

and starting 0.11.0 it's four tests:

* array-test
* buffer-test
* bit-util-test
* rle-encoding-test

(list not including parquet-* tests)

I did bisect and found that the three tests were broken in 479c011a6ac7a8f1e6d77ecf651a4b2be9e5eec0

comments.body: I'm surprised you managed to compile Arrow on a 32-bit platform at all. Arrow is definitely not supported on 32-bit targets. Even if it might work, its performance will probably be suboptimal due to the widespread use of 64-bit integers in the codebase.

[~veprbl] thanks for finding the problematic commit. 32-bit platforms are getting more exotic but I think we should try to fix if it's not too difficult. Last time I tried compiling on a 32-bit raspberry pi was over a year ago
There's an i386 Ubuntu image on Dockerhub, we can probably use that to debug https://hub.docker.com/r/32bit/ubuntu/. Patches welcome in the meantime
